On march 14, 2015
[6826491]

Welcome to the eleventh twelfth iteration of this thread! Ask your simpler game questions here, and see them answered (usually!)

We use a particular format, so please be sure to number your questions and answers accordingly. Also, please attempt to search the forum before you ask; the answer may have been posted in a previous thread.

Format Example:

(Person with a question) Q1: If the ship moves, and we don't arrive at a planet, what happens to the planets we scanned?

(Person with an answer) A1: Those planets are lost forever, and you have to scan for new ones.

Before you post, consider this:

You probably shouldn't reveal too many details about your ship in your question. If your character isn't an important part of your question, leave your identity out. Whether you're Mush should also be left out, unless the question directly relates to Mush activity.

If people need more details in order to answer your question, they'll ask for them.

We've seen FAR too many newbies post things like, "I'm so and so and Mush, and this is what's going on on my ship." before asking a question...without realizing that experienced people not only read the forum, they might also read that very question, and might be on your ship. That usually ends badly for the person asking the question.

Q3: If an oxygen tank gets sabotaged, what exactly happens? Is oxygen lost? If so then how much?
On march 16, 2015
Meadow
LastlawyerQ3: If an oxygen tank gets sabotaged, what exactly happens? Is oxygen lost? If so then how much?

A3 If an O2 tank get's damaged, one additional O2 per cycle change is lost for every damaged O2 tank. So if both are broken, you will lose a total of 3 per cycle change.
On march 16, 2015
DarkTheRaven

to elaborate a bit on A3, you lose 1 extra per broken tanks regardless of how it was broken, but a sabotaged piece of equipment will leave no log so if you see a broken oxygen tank and no announcement it was sabotaged

0 broken o2 tanks = 1 lost per cycle
1 broken o2 tank = 2 lost per cycle
2 broken o2 tanks = 3 lost per cycle

Q7: Is it reportable a Janice that didn't pick Shrink because "when she entered the ship it said it was failing"?
Note: It's another language server (spanish).
On march 16, 2015
[7950824]

A7: For this server, that would be worth a report. How we view such things: Making a choice (skill selection or other) with the purpose of making things harder for your team to win (reason doesn't matter - it's just as wrong if you believe that would be more fun, or if you believe that will upset people and really mess them up) is reportable here. I'd assume there as well.

Note that choices made for other reasons are often legal - even if it's not the best possible choice. Mistakes are not sanctionable, intentional attempts to break the rules are.

If you say 'this ship is dying, so I will help it die' in some form - and you're human - for us that is reportable. Now, mush usually can get away with that - their wincon is in line with a ship dying.

A 9:

A 10:
When Defacer is used it immidiately, permanently wipes all room logs (including personal logs) from the targeted room while displaying a message that the archives are scrambled untill the following cycle where room logging will be resumed as normally.

To look for Defaced rooms you should pay attention to how far back you can see the logs and how it relates to the usual trafic of the crew. For example if you were suddenly only able to see 2 recent cycles worth of logs in rear corridor and nothing older than that then something might be up.

Q 14: Revealing yourself as mush is not allowed. But if the situation is useless (aka they plan to do a test on you, they found out already and you run and do something that reveals you anyway) - is it allowed for the mere fun of saying & roleplaying "Muhaha"? Maybe because you want to distract them from the actions of your partner?
On march 20, 2015
[6826491]

A14: It's not unheard of to obviously reveal yourself as Mush, if that's part of the plan. For example, extracting in front of a camera, obviously spiking an inactive player, then using Transfer on that inactive...as part of a rampage. In this example, all semblance of stealth is lost, and you're focusing on dealing as much damage as possible.

Another example: On this ship, I purposely extracted a spore in front of the inactive Eleesha, right before I converted her and rampaged. My plan was that the humans would see the obvious extraction, correctly assume that she was the third Mush, and they'd have to kill her in order to win. Curing her wasn't likely, and she'd been inactive for quite some time, so this virtually guaranteed that they wouldn't have the List. Regardless of what they chose to do with her, it would likely burn more time and AP that they couldn't afford.

As it turned out, they didn't check on her, or at the very least least, not before the log of my extracting disappeared. The Mush team won, in the end.

On that same ship, I killed my newbie partner Derek, because he'd dropped his WT just minutes after selection, and openly spored in front of a human. I didn't even have the chance to PM him to work out a strategy, because he'd been caught almost instantly. I never wanted to have to face the humans alone, but killing him kept my cover, and I was given a mission as a "reward" for my swift action. I could have let one of the humans finish him off, but killing him probably took any suspicion off of me for a while, and I had a net gain of AP from the mission.

In short: Revealing yourself is allowed, provided that in doing so, you're doing more help than harm to your team.
On march 20, 2015
[7950824]

A14 Actually, there's no rule that forbids you from revealing yourself as a mush.

The related rules are that you cannot play against your team, you may not suicide or surrender, you must play to win.... you must not denounce your partners. (Note if you're acting human and another mush is acting mushy, catching them is not specifically forbidden, especially if your cover requires it and you have evidence you 'cannot ignore'.

Very, very often when you are mush if you are detected early your team is going to lose. If you're able to create a plan and get it in motion, a plan that doesn't require your secrecy or even survival - you're not breaking any rules as long as you're seriously trying to win.

So if you post right out of mush selection 'I'm a mush!' then stand there until they kill you.... you're in trouble.

But if you made a plan and are in the process of doing your best to win, and don't need secrecy for yourself anymore - go for it.

As long as you're trying your best to get your current team to win and do not appear to be surrendering, suiciding, or selling out your teammates.... That's not breaking rules. When in doubt, create a PM and explain to yourself what you're doing - if you are reported the judges will be able to view that evidence.

On march 25, 2015
CyberiumShadow

Q21 Is using the Natamy Rifle against someone that is against involuntary mush testing and is/is not mush illegal?
On march 25, 2015
[7950824]

A21: Forcible mush testing is appropriate under all circumstances where a kill without any attempt to test would also be appropriate.

If the person/people 'testing' you have enough evidence for it to be a legal kill, they may legally impose or offer a test to you before or part of your death. You are still permitted to refuse or outright resist this in appropriate ways ("Stop shooting at me you bleepity bleep bleep bleep" may not be a really appropriate way)

If someone kills you (or someone else), in a testing fashion or not and you believe the person was targeted randomly or with insufficient evidence to be a reasonable target, you are definitely allowed to report the people involved.

Random killing, and random mush testing, not cool.
On march 25, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

It depends if you have other reasons to suspect them. If you are just testing at random, then it can be considered griefing. The rifle inflicts heavy damage, including one or several injuries that can be fatal. The person will then have to do DYI surgery or ask a medic to do surgery on them, which can have a heavy AP cost, especially if the surgery fails. Failure also causes sepsis, which can also be fatal if it's not cured rapidly.

The Natamy rifle is not meant for testing. It is meant for killing the mush more easily.
On march 25, 2015
ZaphodBeeblbrox

Q22: Is there a possibility that 2 planets with same direction and distance exist?
On march 25, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

No, it's impossible. Of course you can delete a planet and find another in the same direction and at the same distance. But you can't have them at the same time.
On march 25, 2015
[7950824]

A22 Absolutely, but not at the same time. The maximum number of planets happen to equal 16x2, or 32, which is the four directions times 1 to 9 fuel away AND all the players plus their two workspaces on the astro terminal.

Soon as a planet is deleted from the workspace, it ceases to exist, even having been found again, it's not the same planet and only one that is currently on a workspace can be visited; once the ship moves all planets not at the moved-to location are deleted automatically.

On march 28, 2015
[6826491]

A27: It's also quite possible to wake up with less HP, but no injury.

So, there are three possibilities:

1. Wake up with an injury, and lowered max HP, depending on the injury. A bruised shoulder is -1 to max HP, while a burst nose is -2 to max HP, for example. I've had both of these upon waking up this season. (On different ships, of course.)

2. Wake up with lower HP, but no injury.

3. Wake up with full HP.
On march 28, 2015

Q29: if a food is spoiled, 90% chance to cause food poisoning, is it possible to throw it away somewhere/restore it to health levels?
On march 28, 2015
[6826491]
1pringlei thought that the spored rations are always grabbed first no matter what?

That is correct. They're stacked by level of decay, so all "dubious" rations would be in the same stack. A human who picks up a ration will always pick up a spored one first. Likewise, cooking a ration out of a stack will always cook the spored one first.

A29: Not for restoration, but you can always turn on food destruction for a single day change, and consume all the "good" perishable items. Freezing will stop the decay process, but if it's past any state beyond "dubious" (one day after creation, and still safe) then there is a chance of illness. If you hyperdefrost a decaying item, it will still be decaying.

I like to leave decaying consumables in a turret, and then warn people not to eat them.

Rotten food can give you a disease, but it is not a nasty one, it just lowers max health and happiness by one (who is at max health and happiness late game anyway ?) and makes you dirty (late game, many players are devoted to fighting fires, fixing broken things, killing hunters, moving the ship, doing expos, healing others.... all of those things can be done while dirty) - food poisoning will even go away soon at cycle change, all by itself.

On march 31, 2015
[6826491]

A33: If they are listed as "dubious", then yes, they will be safe if frozen in that state. They'll be on a separate "stack" if placed in the same room with non-dubious rations, but there will be no ill effects.

Consumables are fully safe the day that they're generated, and still fully safe the following day (when they become "dubious".) Consumables that get beyond dubious (the following day) will carry the risk of disease.

Also note that freezing consumables past the "dubious" state will not remove any ill effects. It just prevents them from decaying further. Frozen fruit/coffee will also require the use of the Microwave to hyperdefrost them, and yes, this action carries the risk of interrupting the Sol link.

A34/35. Medics can do surgery with the medkit (not bandages). It's the same problem with using medkit to heal illnesses though; you cannot heal if the person is not missing hp. Get someone to punch you in the face

On march 31, 2015
[6826491]

A34, 35, 36: If you have Nurse, but not Medic, you can't perform surgeries on other people. The Medic skill is also what allows you to perform surgery on yourself and others with the Medkit.

Without Medic skill, you'd need to lie down on the medlab bed just like anyone else to perform DIY surgery. A Nurse just has free healing points to do this.

Bandages only heal HP. They do nothing for injuries, and you can't use them if your HP is full. Injuries also reduce your max HP, so you are technically already at full HP when you wake up with an injury.

Q51: I'm standing next to Stephen who had copied Observant from Eleesha. It's 50mins after last action and he "noticed something interesting" just right now when nothing is happening. Janice who is in a dorm write just something on the wall. Does that count for observant to notice or what?
On april 8, 2015
[7950824]

No, Observant catches stuff that happens right now, and puts it in red in the roomlog right now, or it 'catches' stuff that was already red in the roomlog. The observant player does not need to be active to catch stuff happening now, it'll automatically be placed in the roomlog in red for all to see at the moment it is done, if it happens.

An Observant player cannot go mess around in a room where someone earlier spored or spiked and 'eventually' reveal that old, hidden action. If it wasn't seen when it was done, it won't be. But observant folks randomly 'notice' already revealed red stuff in the logs.

Q57

If they kill your mush companion, and then they discover you, can you surrender and ask for serum?
On april 10, 2015
TeufelsAdvokat

A57: No. Never ask for the Serum or offer it to the Mush as human.
On april 10, 2015
[6826491]

A57: No player is allowed to surrender, and this is specifically forbidden by the rules. Even offering the cure to a Mush, or you as a Mush hinting that the humans could cure you, could lead to a sanction. The reason for this stance is simple: If the other party takes the offer seriously, then those involved (on both teams) have just spoiled the game. Neither side should ever entertain the notion of offering a "cease-fire" in order to cure the Mush - not even to "buy time" for some other action to take place.

If the humans offer the cure to the Mush, and the Mush accepts, they've just spoiled the game, but to be fair, the humans are also responsible for making the offer in the first place. In this case: The cured Mush is responsible for spoiling the game, and the human(s) who made the offer would be responsible for incitation to seriously spoil the game. Both parties involved should be reported if this ever takes place.

Q73 : How to jump ship ? I've read it many times, don't know how it works ?

On april 17, 2015
Chime

A73: Jumping on a ship simply refers to selecting a character and starting a new game thus jumping on a ship...

Or do you mean group jumps? In that case people who want to jump together try to end up on the same ship by comparing their character selection as in Stephen, Eleesha, Chun and Ian are offered to both at the same time and one takes Stephen and the other Ian because the probability is high that you'll be on the same ship then. If you try that with a whole lot of people or jump at different times the one who's already aboard keeps an eye out for which characters have been taken and which are still asleep updating the still ship-less about changes so he can try to hop on it too.

And then there are mass jumps like MMM (one Saturday in the month I think) and Mush Sunday (every Sunday) where forum-goers agreed to jump around a certain time to fill the ships with more actives than the average random ship.

[7950824]

A 85 follow up: Please do report that rule breaker. You and your human team may do anything you like about the surrendering mush - you didn't break the rules, the mush did.

The rules require a player not to surrender. Everyone has to play to win. One is also not allowed to spoil the game, and part of the game is the competition between humans and mush. (Note secrecy is NOT absolutely required - if a mush member or team sees a good way to help get a mush win that doesn't need secrecy? That's fine to attempt. I personally revel in revealing myself as mush in the process of getting mush wins. I love to be hunted and some of my favorite mush moments have happened during several cycles in a row where the human team knew I was mush and were unable because of various details I helped set up to kill me right away.... while my plans progressed nicely.)

However, you're also asking 'what should I do?' The answer to that, human who has neither surrendered nor spoiled the game, is whatever you want.

Had you said "Come on, mush, give up, say who you are, we'll cure you" - then you would have broken a rule - it's called 'incitation to spoiling' - it's against the rules to invite or teach someone to break the rules (even if they don't break them because of your words).

But you didn't do that, no one on your team did - you were just innocently, honestly playing, and BOOM this happened.

So you can do anything you want about it.

Last time it happened to me, there were still two alphas, was right after mush selection. Alpha 1 was planning a rampage. Alpha 2 decided this ship could get her to Eden, so she opened a PM to me (.... whoops? well, we are all anonymous on ship. That particular ship I was acting very much a leader... Oh, and this was before I became a mod), told me who both alphas were, told me Alpha 1's plans, begged me to kill him before he could ruin this ship or even just kill anyone, to get her cured and get us all to Eden (Huh? I don't get to eden very often either).

I happened to be offline, so when I didn't respond she took the grenade, used it on her partner, took the knife and finished stabbing him to death (sure enough, he was mush), and told the ship under his death message that she and I had caught him for his suspicious behavior and if they had any questions about how we caught him, ask me.

So, when I logged in, I read this.... and turned to the mods with a PM, asking what the rules said about what I had to do about this surrendering mush.

And was told 'anything I and the other humans liked; we hadn't broken any rules; report her, then do anything from kill to cure'.

Heh. So I made a PM with everyone but her (hey! All humans, how.... 'nice' ), explained the situation to them all, and asked for a ship-wide vote. I think the ship's decision was to kill her, to not reward that behavior even for 1 game. I don't remember that part as well, was a long time ago and the 'HUH?!?!' part of it for me wasn't what we did about her, but what she did.

Good luck, Venus! Keep having fun.

[6826491]
SorooshQ 95 : Is it strange that we don't got hunters for 3 days? o.O

A95: No, but it can happen especially if your ship's AP expenditure is low. However, the next wave you get will be MUCH larger than normal for that day/cycle.

Example: You kill the initial hunter wave, and don't get any until D4. Expect a wave of 18-24 hunters in that wave, even though you won't normally see that number in a wave until past D7.
On april 25, 2015
Dzanek

That's unfair. It's simply matter of luck. Because if you get small waves of hunters every 4 cycles, there are pilots who wake up and get rid of them. On april 25, 2015
[6826491]

There's a trick to get around that, Patryk - You move the ship. Moving the ship triggers a wave, in most circumstances. You then clear the small waves this way, and prevent the buildup to larger than normal waves.
On april 25, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?
PatrykSzczescieThat's unfair. It's simply matter of luck. Because if you get small waves of hunters every 4 cycles, there are pilots who wake up and get rid of them. But if no wave in 3 days... what could pilots do with excess AP? And when 35 hunters appear, pilots cannot have more AP than certain limit including food on this ship.

It's not that unfair because, precisely, it gives pilots time to have full AP again. Sometimes the waves are too close and it doesn't give enough time for pilots to gain enough AP, for patrol ships to regain their charges or for plasma shield to regenerate.

And if your pilots try to tackle a wave of 35 hunters, then you have bad pilots and a bad commander (unless you are very lucky and have 5 or 6 pilots). When you get a big wave of hunters, you move the ship first so as to only have about 50% the following cycle.

Q 96 : So another one,If captain move ship and hunters follow how much time its take for them to shoot? I heard its 2 cycle,Right?

On april 26, 2015
Kyubey

A96
Hunters came on C1 while ship was not moving.
If you don't move, they will not shoot C2, only C3. If you move the ship on C1, they will shoot also on C3.

Ship was moving on C1, stopped on C2 and new hunters came. They will shoot on C3 without waiting.

- Moving will make 2-3 extra hunters to spawn,

On april 30, 2015
Aerial

Q101:

D1C8
2 people ate rations

D2C2 one of them claims that he can't eat
The other eats coffee + ration

Does it mean one of them is a mush?
On april 30, 2015
[7950824]

A101 Not necessarily.

You cannot eat when your satisfaction is above 2, but you can eat when your satisfaction is 0, 1, or 2.

Eating a ration adds 4 satisfaction. If you were already at 2 satisfaction on D1C8 (for example, if you had been at 0, then ate a ration D1C6) then you would have a satisfaction of 6.

Every cycle you normally lose one satisfaction (tapeworm can change that, nothing else I am aware of). So a human with a 6 satisfaction on D1C8 would need to wait until D2C4 to be able to eat anything again.
On april 30, 2015

DangerTime

I was shot by the natamy rifle. Now I have a punctured lung, hemoraging, and my walky talky doesn't work. I have been removed from the public channel. When I open a private channel my text does not get posted. What the heck is going on?
On may 3, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Punctured lungs make you mute, which also makes you deaf (Mush logic again). First thing you need to do is cure those injuries. If you have a medic (usually Finola), try to communicate with her using post-it notes and ask her to do surgery on you.

If you can't do that, go to medlab, lie on the bed, click on the surgery pod and do DIY surgery on yourself. Be careful, it costs 4 AP each time, and it can fail (which causes sepsis, an illness that's more dangerous that haemorrhage, unless you're mush). So you'd better have a lot of AP in case you need to do DIY surgery several times and then heal sepsis.

On may 4, 2015
[7950824]

A112 follow up

I assume you're at least in part asking about trying to connect to Sol as part of the 'comms work' before mush selection.

Only the characters already on the ship gain morale from the first time connection to Sol. For that reason, some feel that connecting to Sol before ship fill is very bad form. I personally discourage efforts to connect to Sol before ship fill.

Rebel bases will come with or without connection to sol, but Neron will not announce them if the connection is down. They still are there.

You have approximately `12 cycles to decode a rebel base from when it first arrives. That number might be a little off, but it's for sure over 9 cycles.

There is no D1 base. D2 base gives glory.... but if it needs to be skipped because there is no comm officer the loss is only glory. D3 base has mechanical benefit for humans, but even if your ship is not full, on D4C1 the game will start, titles assigned, so it will be possible to work on then no matter what.

[8709657]

Q113 : Eleesha has noticed something interesting...
Eleesha has noticed something interesting...


I found this on my logs when I'm in Nexus with 3 people. It appeared twice. But what does it means? There is nothing unusual in my logs. What did I noticed ???

On may 5, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

You probably noticed someone eating twice, or two people eating, a few hours before.

If you are very lucky, Eleesha's Observant skill can reveal a furtive action (like spiking) when there is no camera. But in that case, the message "Eleesha has noticed something interesting" appears at the same time as the action, which becomes visible in the logs as if there was a camera (example).

Most of the time, Eleesha only notices secret actions (eating, hiding, extracting a spore...) that were already visible because there was a camera or witnesses. Eleesha can notice them several cycles later (example). That's probably what happened for you.

A130 Ninja is independent of privacy statuses. When the ninja is attacking, it generates the (public) attacking logs normally except for the bit where it turns the attacker's name into "someone".

For example, Someone hits Chun with a rightinstead ofGioele hits Chun with a right
On may 9, 2015
[6826491]

A130 supplemental: Note that you can't turn it off, once the skill is selected. so if there are logs of only two people being in the room when an attack takes place, then you'll give yourself away (usually - Defacer might help.) It's not a bad skill to have in a crowded dorm, with at least a few non-confirmed humans standing up...but I find that it's far too situational. The lack of an ability to select when you use it is a major drawback.

Items are revealed when searching in order of last hidden. So if you hide the medkit and an extinguisher and someone else hides a post-it note in the same room then the post-it will be discovered first followed by the extinguisher and so on.

On may 19, 2015
Kenik
AbinmorthQ157 Is there a limit to the amount of mage books a person can read?

A157 Sort of: you can only have the SKILL from one. But reading multiple of them is possible, just bear in mind they overwrite the previous book read.

On may 19, 2015
[6826491]
Kenik13A157 Sort of: you can only have the SKILL from one. But reading multiple of them is possible, just bear in mind they overwrite the previous book read.

No, the option to read a second book is almost always struck out, if you've read one during that trip. The only exceptions to this are when you are the subject/victim of Transfer, and if you are a cured Mush. In both cases, your human skills are reset. In these specific cases, a skill gained from a mage book is gone forever, and another book may be read.
On may 19, 2015
Kenik

Well don't I look the fool. Now the question I'm at is where I got that misinformation.

Anyway thanks for correcting my err Mr. Spazticus.

On may 20, 2015
NERON

A163
Jumping together on randoms is possible. Guarantees are not. There are many ships filling at once. You may end up on any one of them
The best you could do is have one guy jump and report back the crew rosters to the others. Selections of a player are always from the same ship. For example, if you have Eleesha, Ian, Finola and Chun, it won't matter who you pick, it would be the same ship. Therefore, if your friend is on a ship, And Chun is already awake there, you will know that it's not your ship and to wait for your selections to change.

As for castings, bigger is always better Depending on the XP level, launching a ship requires a minimum of 32, 24 or 16 people who have pushed the "ready" button. The more XP (ie "bigger" ), the less people you need to launch. Castings ships only take people from the castings and do not mix with randoms.
The only way to make sure you land on the same ship even with castings is to join one it enough XP to launch with 16, but none exist currently

Perhaps it's for the best. What if one of you is mush?

[6826491]
zorkgreyDoes that means that trying to recruit another person who lives with me to play will get me in trouble? This is somehow disheartening to know.

A user may only have ONE account, and accounts may never be sold, traded, or shared with another person.

If your friends wish to play, they each need their own account. If you live together, the system may flag you for it, but it's possible to fix that.

That said, we've had multiple people try to claim their multis as friends/family, and try to cheat the system. These people usually have their accounts deleted. While this isn't directed at you personally, it is a warning to anyone who wants to create multiple accounts. We judge such account abuse cases harshly. As long as you and anyone else living with you are following the rules, you'll be fine.

Q210
How much oxygen ship lose each day?
On june 1, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

On june 2, 2015
DarkTheRaven

As a more mapped out diagram(?)

Standard O2 loss = 1/cycle
O2 loss with a broken O2 tank = 2/cycle until tank is fixed
O2 loss with both O2 tanks broken = 3/cycle until tank(s) are fixed

This means at most assuming no oxygen is gained or taken you can lose 24 per day
Ad at minimum you lose 8

ChryostenQ215 If someone is chosen as a Mush and haven't picked all their skills yet, are they unable to pick skills marked as 'Lost' on the wiki? Similarly if someone was converted into Mush, do they lose the skills marked as 'Lost' on the wiki?

If you are chosen as alpha mush, there are too possibilities :

  • If you have activated the "Advanced Mush" setting (My account > My settings > My configurations > Activate Advanced mush), you can choose your human skills by clicking on the small mushroom icon that appears below your mush skills. You can pick any skill, even one that's lost, but of course it won't have any effect. Be careful about what skill you choose.
  • If you haven't activated the Advanced Mush setting, your skills will be picked at random as soon as you become mush.

As for beta mush, they will keep their skills but will lose their effects if it's a lost skill as mush.

If there are 4-16 open slots on the ship, you are given 4 choices, randomized from those available. If there are 1-3 slots, the exact characters available are given. If you do not like your selection, simply wait an hour or two and it will change on it's own

On june 11, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Yes, it happens when you're a in a broken patrol ship (and when it's destroyed by hunters, I think). The pilot is ejected when the patrol ship explodes, but if they don't have a spacesuit, they die.

The message is actually a Neron announcement. It wasn't Frieda who said it (I mean, it wasn't the player who wrote the message).


To prevent something like that pilots should probably always go out with spacesuits when they have to stay longer outside ^^ As a rule, and if possible, pilots should never stay outside. The patrol ship doesn't gain charges and can be damaged by hunters, and the pilot isn't in a bed and gets no additional AP. There's also the risk of being abandoned, accidentally or not, or the risk of preventing the crew from moving because they're waiting for you.

If you ever happen to be in a patrol ship that breaks at cycle change (either randomly, or because of a fire or electrical spike in the bay), you must fix it immediately. Otherwise, you'll get ejected and die.

Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?
IsidarthA246 - No. They appear randomly. Fires may appear in adjacent rooms to existing fires at each cycle change, this is them spreading, but the initial fires can happen anywhere.

Fires can spread at cycle change, but they can also spread (or cause damage) immediately. If you have two fires that start at the same time, it's quite likely that they're in adjacent rooms because it's actually one fire that spread.

Of course, you can also have two random fires in two different parts of the ship.

On june 18, 2015
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Torture, Premonition and Confident reveal the action buttons you click (not all of them, but most of them). If you open a channel and then invite someone, it doesn't count as a real action, as opposed to the "Whisper" button, which will be revealed.

The list of actions that are not revealed is in the Actions part of Twinpedia.

A - About food test and other stuff.

Some people have some kind of morale code or something. Special rules how mushes and humans should play. It's something like:
- Humans should not do food tests or announce every single ap they used including ap from rations
- Mushes should not rampage just from start
- Mushes should not reveal themselves for any kind of rush tactics - pyro
- PILGRED rush is unfair too
But then somebody else, who does not care about such things (or have different code) use some actions and half of team cries about how 'boring' or 'unfair' it is.

Well my opinion here - while you are on random ships just stop crying

All actions that really break the game are impossible by game mechanic or SDF rules. If they are allowed - you can decide not to use them yourself, but be ready to counter them from others.

If humans are doing mass tests you can do something like:
- Rampage
- Uninstall cameras/Deface protected rooms + visit unprotected rooms, make 1-2 extra mushes on day change from checked humans + do some damage - make all their previous tests meaningless
- Destroy Icarus (solo expo with low hp) fail O2 collection, kill teches before taking off
- Infect/transfer to one of those tested humans

But ofc it's much easier just to say - those actions are boring or unfair, they should not play like those, I played "fair", so I lost, instead of thinking how to prevent such strategies or counter them.

[6826491]
PatrykSzczescieBy the way what would happen if two selected to Mush people had already been dead? Would certain researches which include dead Mush be available?

It actually depends on exactly how they die. Quarantined Mush don't count as a dead Mush for research purposes, for example. But if they get quarantined, and something else kills them before the quarantine takes place, like a steel plate, then they'd count as a "dead Mush".
